title: Academy of Idaho (1901-1915)
description: Collection information undefined.

title: Banner Mining and Milling Company
description: Letters and other documents received by Henry K. Doll, of Scranton, Pennsylvania, from officers of the Banner Mining and Milling Company relating to his investment in and operations of the Banner Mine in Silver City, Idaho.
subject: Environment & Agriculture

title: Bannock County Images
description: A digital repository through which researchers, students, scholars, genealogists, historic interpreters, authors, and members of the general public can access information pertaining to Bannock County, Idaho.  This is a collaborative project between Special Collections and Archives, Eli M. Oboler Library, Idaho State University, Pocatello, Idaho; the Bannock County Historical Society, Pocatello, Idaho; and, the South Bannock County Historical Center, Lava Hot Springs, Idaho.
subject: East Idaho

title: Basque Arborglyph Database
description: Basque sheepherders created these tree carvings, called arborglyphs, while working in remote areas throughout Idaho during the twentieth century.
subject: Idaho History & Photographs

title: Benedicte Wrensted Photograph Collection
description: Collection information undefined.

title: BJC Newspaper clippings
description: A collection of newspaper clippings about about Boise Junior College, 1932-1953.

title: Blanche Kunz Collection on William E. Borah
description: This collection consists of a scrapbook and a magazine collected by Blanche Kunz, of Arbon, Idaho. The scrapbook contains newspaper clippings on the final illness, death, and funeral of U.S. Senator William E. Borah in 1940 as well as a few later clippings relating to Borah. Additionally it features a 1940 letter to Kunz from Senator Kenneth S. Mackenzie of Idaho Falls about the poem he wrote entitled “The Bier of Senator Borah.”
subject: Idaho Public Figures

title: Bob Lorimer Photographs
description: Bob Lorimer (1918-1975) was a writer, columnist and photographer for several Boise Valley newspapers including the Idaho Statesman, 1964-1975. The collection consists of approximately 1,500 black and white negatives, including 35 mm and 2 1/2 x 2 inch up to 4 x 5 inch. The collection number is P2006.18

title: Boise Development Collection
description: Reports, brochures, advertisements and other resources that promote, or plan for, growth in the city of Boise, Idaho. These documents mostly originated from public departments within the city of Boise, but some were authored by local and national consultants.

title: Boise Public Library Ethnic History Archive
description: Over 200 clippings from the Idaho Statesman spanning over 50 years.
subject: Southwest Idaho

title: Boise Territorial Images 1863-1890
description: Images of Boise, Idaho from 1863-1890

title: Browsing Photographs Collection
description: The Browsing Photographs Collection is comprised of a vast array of subjects and locations from across Idaho. Biographies, general subjects, Native American groups, Idaho towns and Boise subjects come together to collectively form the Browsing Collection.

title: Business and Professional Women's Club
description: Scrapbook of newspaper clippings, programs, and other memorabilia, documenting activities of the Meridian, Idaho, club, the Idaho State Federation of Business and Professional Women’s Clubs (BPW), and events in Meridian, Idaho between the years 1928 to 1930.

title: Catholic Women's League Collection
description: This scrapbook, compiled between the years of 1911 and 1947, focus on the membership and activities of the Catholic Women's League of Boise, Idaho.

title: CCC in Idaho Collection
description: The Civilian Conservation Corps, 1933-1942, had a tremendous impact on the State of Idaho, from development of roads and trails to construction of parks and other recreational facilities to pest eradication.  The database includes a variety of historic photographs and other materials documenting this important aspect of Idaho history

title: Cecil D. Andrus
description: Photographs from the Cecil D. Andrus Papers (MSS 140) which span his personal and professional life, including his two terms as Governor of Idaho and his term as Secretary of the Interior under President Carter.

title: Church Women United
description: The Church Women United Scrapbook, then known as the Boise Inter-Church Council, covers the organization's activities between 1941-1981. Highlights of this scrapbook include a history of the Council, the various community service projects the group organized, and the various ways the Church Women aided European Refugees after World War II.

title: Claudio Beagarie photographs of California Farm Workers
description: From 1965 to 1967, photographer Claudio Beagarie documented through photos the farm workers' struggle for economic justice and civil rights in California. A union activist with a commitment to progressive causes, Beagarie captured images of farm workers in their homes, in the fields, and marching with Cesar Chavez, cofounder of the United Farm Workers of America and the best-known leader of the movement.

title: Doc Roach Fire Collection
description: Selected photographs from the William Francis "Doc" Roach Collection. Roach worked for the Boise Fire Department from 1911 to 1965 as a fireman, dispatcher, fire prevention captain, and fire marshal. Roach collected more than 400 photos documenting fires, fire equipment, and firefighters in Boise. Dated mostly from the 1940s and 1950s, many of the photographs depict buildings and street scenes in Boise.

title: E. Jane Gay Photograph Collection
description: Collection information undefined.

title: Earl Wayland Bowman Collection
description: Earl Wayland Bowman, "the Ramblin' Kid," promoter of Idaho and author of popular stories and novels of the American West, includes two scrapbooks of his work.

title: Edward F. Rhodenbaugh Collection
description: Items that represent the life and work of a Geology and Science educator from Idaho. The Edward Rhodenbaugh collection contains many photos of scenic Idaho, lantern slides with teaching aids, journals about field trips to geological sites in Idaho and Oregon, and correspondence and manuscripts relating to geology and education.

title: Edward Stevenson Collection
description: The Edward Stevenson Collection was a gift to Idaho State University from Stevenson's family and includes several hundred sketches of costumes by Stevenson from his early days as an apprentice to his final years as costume designer for DesiLu Productions. It also includes sketches by other designers, scrapbooks and photographs of both his family and his Hollywood associations; the digital collection contains 102 images of Stevenson's costume designs.
subject: Music, Literature, and Entertainment

title: Elmer Pyne's Collection of Hazelton, ID Photographs
description: Collection information undefined.

title: Episcopal Diocese of Idaho Records
description: Records of the Episcopal Church. Diocese of Idaho, including that of bishops, committees, and other diocesan officers and organizations; together with convocation and convention journals, clergy files, property records, financial records, confirmation lists, parish registers, publications, photos, and other records.

title: Ethel O'Connor Sales Collection
description: Scrapbook of clippings from Boise newspapers chiefly about the Ethel Sales Dance Band and Mrs. Sales’ work as organist at the Egyptian Theater in Boise.

title: Everett L. 'Shorty' Fuller Photographs
description: Shorty Fuller was an Idaho Statesman photographer in Boise, Idaho and the surrounding areas from approximately 1938-1942.

title: Frank and Bethine Church Collection
description: The entire photograph collection of Frank and Bethine Church, spanning their young adult years in Boise, Idaho, 1940-1943, the early political career of Frank as Idaho Legislature, 1952-1956, and U.S. Senator, 1958-1980, and Bethine's involvement in social and environmental issue in the 1990s to 2010. The majority of the photographs document the many campaigns, political events in Washington D.C. and around the world, and daily work as a U.S. Senator. Church's involvement in foreign relations is well documented in photographs, as well as his work with other various Senate committees.

title: Fred Lindenschmidt Collection
description: The Fred Lindenschmidt Collection contains documents and photographs from 1862 to 1900. The documents include equipage reports and orders from the Civil War as well as financial statements, land agreements and correspondence concerning Henry O. Harkness.
subject: Idaho History & Photographs

title: George Shoup (1836-1904 Papers)
description: The George Shoup (1836-1904) Papers consist of letters and documents formerly in the possession of Idaho's first Governor, and United States Senator. Subjects in the collection pertain to Indian fighting, business methods, transportation, and politics in early Idaho, circa 1867 - 1900. The items in the digital collection represent only a fragment of the physical one.
subject: Idaho Public Figures

title: Gertrude B. Hein Collection
description: Scrapbook compiled by Gertrude B. (Downey) Hein, consisting of letters, typescript poems, and newspaper columns, all written by Hein's sister, Belle Angstadt, of Priest River and Coolin, Idaho.

title: Gracie Pfost
description: Gracie Bowers Pfost's entire collection of materials relating to her service as an Idaho Democratic congressional representative from 1952 to 1962.

title: Hazelton, Idaho - Glass Plate Negatives
description: This collection is only comprised of 11 photographs but they are remarkable in what they depict and thier detail. They are 5x7 glass plate negatives images that have been scanned directly from the plate. The detail from a glass plate image surpasses many of the digitally enhanced images seen today. The images are of different and never seen before views of Hazelton. These photographs bring to light what character and meaning a photograph can have.
subject: Idaho History & Photographs

title: Historic Boise State Collection
description: Images from the Boise State University Archives photo collection in the Boise State University Library, documenting the history and evolution of the campus, student life, personalities, and events, from the university's founding as Boise Junior College in 1932 to the present day.

title: Idaho Basque Arborglyph Database
description: Basque sheepherders created these tree carvings, called arborglyphs, while working in remote areas throughout Idaho during the twentieth century. Loneliness and the need for communication moved the herders to leave their mark on the world around them. Usually written in Basque or Spanish, these arborglyphs record herders’ names, thoughts, and drawings and often represent the only historical data about sheepherders. Herders carved almost exclusively on aspens. As the trees grew, they healed themselves and black scars formed visible designs. On average aspens live less than 100 years; consequently, most of the oldest arborglyphs have already been lost. The threats of decay, fire, and vandalism accelerate the need for arborglyphs to be documented. The tree carving tradition began with the Basques and continues today by herders from Central and South America, most often from Peru and Chile. - Written by Audra Hoyt.

title: Idaho Railroad Visual History
description: Explore the Street Car and Idaho Railroads. Collection currently being added to.
subject: Idaho History & Photographs

title: Idaho State College (1947-1963)
description: Collection information undefined.

title: Idaho State University Oral History Project Collection
Idaho State University President's House
description: Collection information undefined.

title: Idaho State University Theatre Department
description: Collection information undefined.

title: Idaho Technical Institute (1915-1927)
description: Collection information undefined.

title: Idaho Wilderness
description: The Idaho Wilderness collection commemorates the 50th anniversary of the signing of the U.S. Wilderness Act with primary source material documenting the political issues surrounding the management of public lands in Idaho.

title: Image Catalog for Idaho Statehouse
description: The Image Catalog for Idaho Statehouse includes images selected specifically for display in Idaho's statehouse, both public spaces and private offices.  The collection includes historic photographs, maps, documents and more.

title: J.A. Hanson Photographs
description: John A. Hanson was born in Denmark and came to the United States when he was nineteen years old.  He worked as an itinerant photographer in California before settling in Moscow, Idaho in 1890 where he was in partnership with Henry Erichson. In 1892 he moved to Grangeville, Idaho and established the “ Elite Studio. ”  He was the leading photographer in Grangeville until 1910.  This collection includes 48 of Hanson's photographs.

title: Japanese American Citizens League (JACL) Collection
description: Collection information undefined.

title: Joseph Yolo Collection
description: Scrapbook compiled by Yolo documenting his trip into the Craters of the Moon lava fields of Idaho with Robert Limbert’s exploring expedition of 1926; together with Yolo’s typewritten daily chronicle of the expedition, which he recorded in the form of a newspaper entitled "The Luna Press."

title: Kathleen (Kitty) Gurnsey Collection
description: Correspondence, memoranda, speeches, clippings, photos, and other papers, from Mrs. Kathleen W. (Kitty) Gurnsey's career as an Idaho state legislator (1975-1996) and her chairmanship of the Joint Finance-Appropriations Committee (JFAC), the legislature's budget committee. Includes material relating to the role of women in government, 1970s-1990s.

title: Latino Americans Oral History Project
description: Collection information undefined.

title: Len Jordan Collection
description: Leonard Beck Jordan served as Governor of Idaho from 1951 to 1955 and United States Senator from 1962 to 1973. Jordan was influential in hosting the Western Governors Conference in Boise in 1952. He served on the International Joint Commission under President Eisenhower, and was an important supporter of Idaho Business. This digital collection consists of select photographs of Jordan's career.

title: Leo J. Scoop Leeburn
description: Leo Scoop Leeburn was a famous Boise area photographer that captured many iconic Boise images.His photo journalism career started in 1943, took pictures up until his death in 2002 at the age of 81.His photos appeared in The Idaho Statesman and Leeburn has been labeled the Unofficial photographer-at-large, and A Boise institution.His photographs show how life was in Boise in the 1940s from work to activities.The Boise Urban Renewal Project was also documented by Leeburn.His work has been...
subject: Southwest Idaho

title: Leonard J. Howard Collection
description: Leonard J Howard documented the important period between 1899 and 1939. Howard traveled throughout Idaho and created a visual history of the roads, construction, and what life was like in Idaho during this time period.
subject: Idaho History & Photographs

title: Lewiston State Normal Zimmerly Air Transport Photograph Album
description: The album documents the Navy Flight training program contracted by Lewiston State Normal and Zimmerly Air Transport in Lewiston, Idaho 1942-1943. This photograph album contains photos of runways, offices, shops, personnel, airplanes, Navy cadets and officers, athletics, and classes. There are also photographs of the Lewiston State Normal School, aerial views of Lewiston-Clarkston and Fish Lake.
subject: North Idaho

title: Lilly J. Eichelberger
description: Scrapbook compiled by Eichelberger, Senator Frank Church’s junior high school English and social studies teacher, chiefly documenting Church’s presidential campaign in 1976, but also containing occasional letters between them. Includes Eichelberger’s response (1939) refuting a letter to the editor claiming that an article on foreign policy published under Frank Church’s name in a Boise newspaper was too sophisticated to have been written by a junior high school student.

title: Lloyd S. Furniss Collection
description: Collection information undefined.

title: Lyle Smith
description: Correspondence, teaching and coaching material, memorabilia, articles, and photos relating to Smith's participation in high school and college sports in Idaho, his career as football coach at Boise Junior College (1946-1968) and Athletic Director (1969-1980), and his World War II service with the U.S. Navy as a physical training instructor.

title: Lyman Wilbur Afghanistan Collection
description: Photographs and diary pages relating to Lyman Wilbur's visits to Afghanistan in 1957 and 1958. Wilbur was a vice president of Morrison Knudsen Co. a civil engineering and heavy construction firm responsible for a multi-million dollar contract to build irrigation infrastructure in the Helmand Valley of Afghanistan. The project included three dams, a canal system, and planned farming community.

title: Manuscript Finding Aids (collection descriptions)
description: This collection consists of finding aids (collection descriptions) for manuscript collections held by the Public Archives and Research Library.

title: Marshall C. Edson Collection
description: Idaho's Department of Fish and Game conservation officer Marshal Edson's scrapbook of a boat trip down the Middle Fork of the Salmon River in March, 1946. The trip was sponsored by the Idaho department of Fish and Game to count big game.

title: Mining In Idaho Collection
description: A pilot project for the Idaho State Historical Society Digital Initiatives Program on the history of mining in Idaho. These images are reflective of the different archival materials available at the Idaho State Historical Society.

title: Nell Shipman Collection
description: Photos and other images documenting the career of silent film star/producer Nell Shipman, who made many of her motion pictures in Idaho in the 1920s. They date mainly from the latter years of her filmmaking career (1920-1924), but there is a sprinkling of earlier and later images. Particularly well represented by stills are her films The Girl From God's Country (1921) and The Grub-Stake (1923). So too are her years at Priest Lake, Idaho, where she made several short films known collectively as The Little Dramas of the Big Places. No known copy of The Girl From God's Country is known to survive, so the stills are all that are left to document that film.

title: No On One Coalition
description: A mixture of newspaper clippings and personal photographs reflecting the events surrounding Proposition One (1992-1994), an anti-homosexual special rights referendum that appeared on the Idaho general election ballot in November 1994. The articles concern the campaigns for and against Proposition 1 and gay rights in general while the personal photographs document Don’t Sign On/No on One’s campaign against Idaho Citizens Alliance (the organization supporting the initiative) and their anti-gay initiative.

title: O. E. Kirkpatrick Photograph Collection
description: The O. E. Kirkpatrick Photograph Collection contains photographs of historic Leesburg, Idaho between 1900 and the 1930s, that depict everyday life from a wedding and social gatherings to portraits of townspeople, including Chinese immigrants.
subject: East Idaho

title: Old Idaho Penitentiary
description: Photographs of the development and of the Old Pen since the late 1800s. Photos are of guards, prisoners and of the prison itself.
subject: Southwest Idaho

title: Olive Grace (Babe) Call
description: Diaries of Boise resident, Olive "Babe" Grace Call and her sister-in-law Exie Call. The diaries start in 1911 when Babe was a teenager. She writes about her daily life, friends, chores, church, and other activities of her and her family.

title: Onffroy Collection
description: Roland Onffroy Collection photographed all of Idaho from the 1940s
subject: Idaho History & Photographs

title: Oral History Collection
description: Collection description undefined

title: Patrick Collins - Idaho Civil War Collection
description: This collection contains military documents,  letters, family documents, and photographs related to the military career of Major Patrick Collins dating between 1833-1867.
subject: Idaho History & Photographs

title: Payette Lakes Progressive Club Collection
description: In 1947, the Payette Lakes Progressive Club, a women’s organization in McCall, Idaho, solicited Idaho authors for letters in return describing “Who are all of you and what made you into authors and poets? And what has Idaho to do with it?” The project organizer, Mrs. William Reitmeir, described the club as “a handful of women in a community civic club” who were “making an effort to acquaint ourselves with this, our state of Idaho.” Responses from 19 authors were placed in a 72-page scrapbook, most of which was filled with typewritten copies of poems by them (and other Idaho poets) and scenic photographs of the Payette Lakes region.

title: Pete Cenarrusa Collection
description: Photos of the career of Idaho Secretary of State Pete Cenarrusa, from 1967 to 2002, the longest-serving public official in Idaho. Photos document various visits to the Basque Country, aviation, and Idaho and national political dignitaries.

title: Peter Beemer Music Manuscript
description: Peter Beemer Manuscript is a 96 page manuscript book covered in canvas, containing the scores of dance tunes from Warren’s Diggins, Idaho, in the 1860’s. Peter Beemer was a miner and musician in Warren's Diggins, Idaho Territory, who led a small dance orchestra, wrote down and arranged the songs which were whistled, hummed or sung to him by various residents of the area. The book was subsequently used by Charles Bemis, saloon keeper, violinist, and a longtime resident of Warren, who was a member of Beemer's original orchestra.

title: R. Harold Sigler Photograph Collection
description: R. Harold Sigler was a professional photographer in Boise from the teens through the 1950s.  Although known primarily as a portrait photographer, Sigler also photographed urban and rural landscapes, public buildings, utilities, schools, churches, businesses and homes, athletic events, parades, fetes, funerals, and theatrical productions.

title: Railroad Collections
description: Collection information undefined.

title: Robert W. Limbert Collection
description: Photos by Limbert and photos of Limbert documenting his exploration of little-known regions of Idaho in the 1910s and 20s, notably what is now known as Craters of the Moon National Monument and Preserve, the Bruneau River canyon, and Sawtooth Mountains. The collection also includes images from his taxidermy business, the Panama-Pacific International Exposition of 1915, and the early years of Redfish Lake Lodge.

title: Stacks
description: Contains all publications by Idaho government agencies not included in any subcollection.

title: Stacks subcollection 2 - Administration, Idaho Dept. of
description: Includes publications from the Idaho Dept. of Administration and its subagencies.

title: Stacks subcollection 3 - Education, Idaho Dept. of
description: Includes publications from the Idaho Dept. of Education and its subagencies.

title: Stacks subcollection 4 - Education, Idaho State Board of
description: Includes publications from the Idaho State Board of Education and its subagencies. Includes Idaho colleges and universities.

title: Stacks subcollection 5 - Fish & Game, Idaho Dept. of
description: Includes publications from the Idaho Fish & Game Dept., Fisheries Div. and Wildlife Div. as well as from  the Conservation Data Center now called the Idaho Natural Heritage Program.

title: Stacks subcollection 6 - Governor, Office of the Idaho
description: Includes publications from the Office of the Idaho Governor and agencies under that office such as PERSI, Idaho Homeoland Security, Liquor Dispensary, Div. of Financial Management, Dept. of Energy Resources, Species Conservation, etc.

title: Stacks subcollection 7 - Health & Welfare, Idaho Dept. of
description: Includes publications from the Idaho Dept. of Health and Welfare and its subagencies.

title: Stacks subcollection 8 - Occupational Licenses, Idaho Bureau of
description: Includes publications from the Idaho Bureau of Occupational Licenses.

title: University of Idaho-Southern Branch (1927-1947)
description: Collection information undefined.

title: Vogel Estate Collection
description: The Vogel Estate Collection was donated in 2008 and features an array of postcards of views around Idaho. These postcards, which are only a fraction of the Postcard collection at ISHS, reflect how images were shared and sent to others. The collection also features views of Sun Valley Lodge when it first opened, Shoshone Falls, Thousand Springs and the Sawtooth Mountains just to name a few.
subject: Idaho History & Photographs

title: W. H. Chapman Diary
description: Diary kept by William (W. H.) Chapman chronicling his daily life and work on McConnell’s Ranch near Horseshoe Bend, Idaho during 1866; his overland journey on horseback back to the Midwest; and social life and work in Jackson, Michigan, and Elgin, Illinois, with family and friends on his return.

title: Western Writers Series Digital Editions
description: Out-of-print booklets of biography and criticism on the American literary west from Boise State University's Western Writers Series.

title: William E. Borah collections
description: Two collections relating to the life and career of U.S. Senator William E. Borah of Idaho: The William E. Borah Papers consist primarily of his published speeches. There is a letter to Franklin Roosevelt and correspondence with Walter White. Also included are photographs, campaign notebooks, and other items related to his Senatorial career. View the finding aid online. C.P. Connolly Correspondence with William E. Borah and Albert E. Horsley (Harry Orchard) consist of 36 letters (1907-1930) to Christopher Powell Connolly (1863-1935) from Borah and 4 letters (1908-1920) to Connolly from Albert E. Horsley (Harry Orchard), convicted assassin of Idaho Governor Frank Steunenberg. C.P. Connolly was a Journalist, mainly with Collier’s Weekly; known as one of the muckrakers.

title: U.S. Bureau of Public Roads (MS281)
description: This manuscript collection was donated to the Idaho State Archives in 1968 from the United States Bureau of Public Roads (BPR) in Boise, Idaho.  It contains records related to Federal Aid Highway Projects in Idaho including reports, maps, schematics, histories, and photographs dating between 1915 and 1961. The photographs in this collection document Idaho's earliest road construction projects, featuring the historical transition from manual labor to steam engines and then gasoline powered equipment.  Many images are of Idaho's natural geography, used by surveyors, before undertaking construction projects.  It also highlights many of Idaho's natural disasters over time including floods, blizzards, slides, and washouts. In 1969 the BPR was decommissioned in favor of a newly organized Idaho Department of Highways (1970), which later became the Idaho Department of Transportation and then finally, the Idaho Transportation Department (ITD).  Materials donated as part of this collection pre-date this institutional transition.

title: Idaho Transportation Department (AR24)
description: This archival record collection from the Idaho Tranportation Department (ITD)features materials and photographs that document the creation and maintenance of Idaho's transportation networks including roads, railroads, bridges, highways, and airports dating from the early 1900s up to 2012, when the documents were transferred to the Idaho State Archives as part of a joint digitization project between the Idaho Transportation Department and the Idaho State Archives.   Materials in this collection originate from ITD Headquarters (ITD HQ), and from each of its statewide districts (Districts 1-6), and include materials from each of it's six divisions: Administration, Aeronautics, Highways, Human Resources, Motor Vehicles, and Transportation Performance.   AR 24 Negatives Index This collection is comprised of an estimated 20,000 to 30,000 photographic negatives, organized alpha-numerically by subject matter, dating from 1945 to 1990.  The Idaho State Archives has digitized 3,227 of these images and made them available on this database.  The complete index is available as well, and is word-searchable.  Images that have not been digitized are available for viewing by request at the Idaho State Archives at 2205 Old Penitentiary Road, Boise Idaho 83712.   AR 24 AERO Materials in this series originated in the Aeronautics Division and features aerial footage as well as airports, airstrips, wreckage, and "Air Breakfast" events together with aviation-oriented subject matter.   AR24 Minute Books The Minute Books document the creation and subsequent activities of the State Highway Commission, a legal body organized in Idaho in May, 1913.  The body was necessary in order to participate in the National Highway Federal Aid program, organized to assist states with the creation of state and national highways.  The minutes record details about the state’s transportation projects including budgets, timelines, project names, and even contractor bids.

title: ITD Headquarters Collection (AR24)
description: This collection comes from the Idaho Transportation Department's main headquarters located in Boise, Idaho.  Altogether it consists of hundreds of thousands of unique documents and photographs created and used by the organization throughout the 20th Century.  The collection includes content created for internal use (surveys, plans and schematics, research projects and experiments, photo documentation, etc.), but also comprises a number of externally-oriented content (promotional, public relations and outreach, public hearings, commemorations, dedications, etc.), as well as basic documentary evidence of the department’s buildings, laboratories, personnel, and seasonal events dating from the early 1900s up to 2012, when the documents were transferred to the Idaho State Archives. Together this collection illustrates the whole of Idaho’s transportation history.

title: District 1 (AR24)
description: District 1 Offices: Benewah, Bonner, Boundary, Kootenai, and Shoshone Counties.  HQ located in Coeur d’Alene.  Collections are oriented around transportation projects occurring within these boundaries and tend to be modern (1960s through early 2000s), highlighting major transportation achievements.  Some duplication between the headquarters and district collections is to be expected. District One Topics: 1996 Flood, I-90, Wallace, Coeur d'Alene, Bridge Construction, U.S. 95 or the North & South Highway

title: District 2
description: District 2 Offices: Clearwater, Idaho, Latah, Lewis, and Nez Perce Counties.  HQ located in Lewiston. Collections are oriented around transportation projects occurring within these boundaries and tend to be modern (1960s through early 2000s), highlighting major transportation achievements.  Some duplication between the headquarters and district collections is to be expected. District Two Topics: Materials Lab (1960s), Bridges and Creeks, U.S. 95 in Salmon River Canyon, Lewis & Clark Highway, Lolo Pass, Maintenance Sheds and Equipment (1940s-1970s), Railroads, Traffic Signs, Personnel Awards and Events, construction projects in Lewiston, Moscow, Kamiah, Orofino, Ahsahka, and Potlatch, State Highways: 3, 7, 8, 9, 11, 13, 14, 62, 64, and 99, and U.S. Highway 12 (1960s/70s).

title: District 3
description: District 3 Offices: Ada, Adams, Boise, Canyon, Elmore, Gem, Owyhee, Payette, Valley, and Washington Counties.  HQ located in Boise.  Collections are oriented around transportation projects occurring within these boundaries and tend to be modern (1960s through early 2000s), highlighting major transportation achievements.  Some duplication between the headquarters and district collections is to be expected. District Three Topics: Highway Projects 1994-1997, Snake River Bridges, Cole and Overland Interchange, Franklin Interchange, Meridian Interchange, Division Dam Bridge, Isaac Canyon, Horshoe Bend Highway, Boise, State Highways 21, 44, and 55, and I-84.

title: District 4
description: District 4 Offices: Blaine, Camas, Cassia, Gooding, Jerome, Lincoln, Minidoka, and Twin Falls Counties. HQ located in Shoshone. Collections are oriented around transportation projects occurring within these boundaries and tend to be modern (1960s through early 2000s), highlighting major transportation achievements.  Some duplication between the headquarters and district collections is to be expected.   District Four Topics: Highway Projects 1994-1997, Wildish, Sweetzer, Hailey, Ketchum, Shoshone, Twin Falls, Clear Lakes, Big Wood River, Malad Gorge, and the Snake River Canyon.

title: District 5
description: District 5 Offices: Bannock, Bear Lake, Bingham, Caribou, Franklin, Oneida, and Power Counties. HQ located in Pocatello.  Collections are oriented around transportation projects occurring within these boundaries and tend to be modern (1960s through early 2000s), highlighting major transportation achievements.  Some duplication between the headquarters and district collections is to be expected.   District Five Topics: Pocatello, Blackfoot, Idaho Falls, Shelley, Soda Springs, Lava Hot Springs, American Falls, American Falls Dam, Fish Creek, Bear Lake Highway, 1997 Snake River Flood, Historical Markers, Bridges, State Highways: 34 and 39, U.S. Highways: 26, 30, 89, 91/191, I-15, I-86 and Massacre Rocks Area.

title: District 6
description: District 6 Offices: Bonneville, Butte, Clark, Custer, Fremont, Jefferson, Lemhi, Madison, and Teton Counties.  HQ located in Rigby.  Collections are oriented around transportation projects occurring within these boundaries and tend to be modern (1960s through early 2000s), highlighting major

title: Minute Books (AR24)
description: These minute books document the creation and subsequent activities of the State Highway Commission, a legal body organized in Idaho in May, 1913.  The body was necessary in order to participate in the National Highway Federal Aid program, organized to assist states with the creation of state and national highways.  The minutes record details about the state’s transportation projects including budgets, timelines, project names, and even contractor bids.   In September, 1913, the commission identified and prioritized the state’s primary transportation needs in consideration of interstate transportation routes that were to make up the National Highway (pp. 4-5). North and South Highway (from Weiser, ID north to the Canadian border - U.S. 95) Western border to SE border (Old Oregon Trail from Bear Lake to Ontario, OR - U.S. 30/I-86/I-84) A southern junction from McCammon to the Utah state line (I-15) A road north from Twin Falls, towards Hailey, Ketchum, etc. (U.S. 93/S.H. 75) Junction from Spokane Bridge, east to the Montana state line (I-90) A road north from Idaho Falls to the Montana state line. (I-15 North)

title: Maps (AR24)
description: Rand McNally road maps of Idaho dating between 1926 and1957.

title: Leonard J. Howard Photo Collection (P1992.44)
description: The Leonard J. Howard Photo Collection consists of 456 black and white photo prints, ranging from 3 x 3 to 8 x 10 inches in size. The collection covers a period between 1899 and 1939, but most were taken in the 1920s. The photographs were removed from two albums and an inventory prepared with identification from the album. The collection documents highway construction throughout the state of Idaho. This historic collection was donated to the Idaho State Archives by the estate of Mrs. Leonard J. Howard in 1992.

title: Idaho Department of Transportation Photo Collection  (P1996.28)
description: This photograph collection consists of 668 black and white prints and photo copies, and 9 rolls of aerographic negative film taken between 1918 and 1955.  The collection is comprised of photographs taken for promotional publications such as the Rand McNally road maps, and aerials used for topographic mapping projects.  In addition to documenting Idaho's highways, the photographs were used to promote scenic Idaho's rivers, lakes, parks, and caves as well as highlight Idaho's  timber, mining, and agricultural industries.  The collection was donated to the Idaho State Archives by the Idaho Department of Transportation in 1996.

title: Chet Bowers Photo Collection
description: Chet Bowers Photo Collection

title: Postcards (P2005.23)
description: This collection consists of approximately 1000 postcards, in both color and black and white, highlighting Idaho cities, towns, and points of interest around the state.  This collection of postcards was donated by various individuals and artificially concentrated into a single collection, organized by subject matter, and dating between 1900 and the early 2000s, the majority originated in the first half of the century.
